meanings.definition: An anxiety disorder characterized by a fear of being in situations where escape might be difficult or help unavailable.
meanings.sent1: Her agoraphobia made it hard for her to leave her house.
meanings.sent2: People with agoraphobia often feel trapped in certain places.
meanings.sent3: The agoraphobia of the cat was evident when it refused to go outside.
meanings.sent4: His agoraphobia was like a heavy chain holding him back from exploring the world.
meanings.sent5: The agoraphobia felt like a dark cloud looming over her every time she stepped outside.

meanings.definition: The fear or avoidance of open or public places.
meanings.sent1: His agoraphobia made him anxious whenever he had to go to crowded places.
meanings.sent2: Agoraphobia can make it challenging to attend social events.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's agoraphobia was evident when it refused to leave its tree.
meanings.sent4: Her agoraphobia was a barrier preventing her from enjoying outdoor activities.
meanings.sent5: The agoraphobia felt like an invisible wall blocking him from venturing into the city.
